name: Hardest "Ash vs Evil Dead" - Pilot Trivia Quiz | Television | 10 Questions

questions.text: Ashley "Ash" Williams is missing a hand, which one?
questions.explanation:
Right.

	Ash's right hand was possessed by evil in a previous film and he was forced to cut it off. The show picks up in the same continuity and he is seen using the false hand to help himself pick up women at the bar in the opening scenes of the pilot.

questions.text: What was the name of Ash's pet iguana?
questions.explanation:
Eli.

	Ash is a lonely and desolate man. Despite having saved the world at least three times, no one believes him. He lives alone in a travel trailer with just Eli his iguana. Ash is shown talking to and feeding his pet early in the episode.

questions.text: The book that was used to summon evil is called the Necronomicon. Where was it stored?
questions.correct: Sitting out in plain sight in Ash's trailer
options: In a safety deposit box at the local bank
On display at the Detroit Museum of Art
In a locked briefcase that Ash carried with him
questions.explanation:
Sitting out in plain sight in Ash's trailer.

	The book, written in blood and bound in human flesh, is simply sitting in Ash's trailer. No one believes that he saved the world, and therefore didn't believe the book had any real power.

questions.text: While sitting at the bar, what drink does Ash order?
questions.explanation:
Moscow Mule.

	A Moscow Mule is a drink that has lime juice, ginger beer and vodka. Ash ordered it while sitting at the bar trying to pick up a woman in the opening few minutes of the pilot.

questions.text: What U.S. State is the show set in?
questions.explanation:
Michigan.

	Both series star Bruce Campbell, and pilot director Sam Raimi are from Royal Oak, MI. They were friends through high school and created the "Evil Dead" franchise together. Campbell played Ash, and Raimi wrote and directed the first three films in the series. The Michigan setting is referenced several times in the movies and in the pilot.

Value Stop.

	In the movies Ash was a stock boy at S Mart. Twenty years later not much has changed, he is still a stock boy, only now he does the job at Value Stop. While at work Ash tends to slack off more than actually do anything, instead getting his coworkers to do it all for him.

questions.text: What attacked Ash in the warehouse at his work?
questions.explanation:
A toy doll.

	There were hundreds of dolls on the shelves near where Ash was "working". One of them spring to life, possessed by the evil that has been following him for decades, and attacked him. After a short fight, leaving Ash with one less tooth than he had before, the doll was destroyed.

questions.text: The first human-demon hybrid that attacked Ash in the pilot was killed by what type of weapon?
questions.explanation:
A shotgun.

	Ash was attacked outside of his trailer. Having used the Necronomicon in a drunken stupor a few days earlier the evil he had been fighting had managed to track him down after years. Luckily Ash was prepared and grabbed a hidden shotgun to blast the head off the demon that attacked him.

questions.text: What was the name of the old lady who was Ash's neighbor?
questions.explanation:
Vivian.

	Vivian was a sweet old lady who was very friendly to Ash in the early parts of the episode. By the end of the episode she was possessed and attacked Ash and his friends in his trailer.  This was the first time either of Ash's friends had seen a member of the Evil Dead. Ash killed Vivian and took off with his trailer soon after.

questions.text: Amanda Fisher, the state police trooper, killed her partner.
questions.explanation:
True.

	Played by Jill Marie Jones, Amanda Fisher is a Michigan State Police Trooper in the series. Early in the pilot she and her partner were investigating a break in at an old house when he was possessed. She was forced to fight him off, and fire multiple shots at him before finally killing him. Side note, she pulled a Derringer handgun as a back up and fired five shots at her partner without reloading. That model of gun only holds two bullets.
